text: This will never be a civilized country until we spend more money for books than we do for chewing gum.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: You know, my main reaction to this money thing is that it's humorous, all the attention to it, because it's hardly the most insightful or valuable thing that's happened to me.
author: Steve Jobs

text: What is a normal childhood? We weren't rich, we were pretty middle-class. My dad survived from job to job with him taking care of so many relatives, he couldn't save any money.
author: Charlie Sheen

text: We need earmark reform, and when I'm President, I will go line by line to make sure that we are not spending money unwisely.
author: Barack Obama

text: My restaurants are never opened on Thanksgiving I want my staff to spend time with their family if they can. My feeling is, if I can't figure out how to make money the rest of the year so that my workers can enjoy the holidays, then I don't deserve to be an owner.
author: Michael Symon
